arguments.description: StaticPages builds extremely optimized websites based on static assets.
arguments.title: StaticPages

argument.name: --project-dir
argument.description: The base path of your project. This builds all the pages in your project. Only the assets that are declared in your pages and views will be built.

argument.name: --new-project
argument.description: Creates a default project in the specified directory. This overwrites the default files / resources provided by the framework. All other existing files are left untouched. Nothing is built by using this option.

argument.name: --asset-prefix-in-browser
argument.description:
Provides a way to prefix assets as seen in the browser. This is always relative to your domain. The resulting prefix is never allowed to end in '/'. This means that '/' would be converted to '' and '/url/' would be converted to '/url'.
The default value is '' which will result in all assets being prefixed with '/'. :)

argument.name: --dev-asset-prefix-in-browser
argument.description: The asset prefix to use when enable-dev-mode is true. See asset-prefix-in-browser for more detail.

argument.name: --clean
argument.description: Cleans all resources in the given projce build directory when true.

argument.name: --enable-asset-fingerprinting
argument.description: Enables or disables asset fingerprinting. An asset fingerprint contains a unix timestamp of the following format just before the file extension: 'file.UTC23452345345.js'. The benefit of using a fingerprint in this manner, is that you can easily write a recursive directory scanner that can clean up old assets from time to time.

argument.name: --enable-dev-mode
argument.description: Enables dev mode. Certain features are only available when dev mode is enabled.

argument.name: --max-data-uri-size-in-bytes
argument.description: Sets the maximum size (in bytes) of data uri embedded resources within css. The default is the limit imposed by IE8 (32768).

argument.name: --max-wait-time-to-validate-external-link
argument.description: Sets the number of milliseconds to wait for an external link reference to return.

argument.name: --prefix-to-ignore-files
argument.description: Files with this prefix will be ignored.

argument.name: --logging-level
argument.description: Controls the level of logging.\n 0 (default) outputs the type of log in caps, I.E. INFO message\n 1 outputs the classname 2 outputs the line number the log was called 3 outputs the file name where the log was called 4 outputs the method name where the log was called 5 outputs a full stack trace on fatal logs

argument.name: --variables
argument.description:
An absolute path to a .properties file. Each property in the properties file is used as a variable value within certain contexts. The following contexts are considered for variable expansion:
 *) xml text nodes
 *) xml attribute nodes
 Variable expansion is accomplished by providing the following pattern within the context: ${variable_name}. Variable names conform to the following pattern: [a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*
